org.dynalang.dynalink

Interface CallSiteDescriptor

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractCallSiteDescriptor

    public interface CallSiteDescriptor
    An immutable descriptor of a call site. It is an immutable objects that contains all the information about a call site: the class performing the lookups, the name of the method being invoked, and the method signature. The library has a default CallSiteDescriptorFactory for descriptors that you can use, or you can create your own descriptor classes, especially if you need to add further information (values passed in additional parameters to the bootstrap method) to them. Call site descriptors are used in this library in place of passing a real call site to guarding linkers so they aren't tempted to directly manipulate the call sites. The constructors of built-in RelinkableCallSite implementations all need a call site descriptor.
    Author:
    Attila Szegedi

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      CallSiteDescriptor changeParameterType(int num, Class<?> newType)
      Creates a new call site descriptor from this descriptor, which is identical to this, except it changes the type of one of the parameters in the method type.
      CallSiteDescriptor dropParameterTypes(int from, int to)
      Creates a new call site descriptor from this descriptor, which is identical to this, except it drops few of the parameters from the method type.

    • Method Detail

      • getNameTokenCount

        int getNameTokenCount()
        Returns the number of tokens in the name of the method at the call site. Method names are tokenized with the colon ":" character, i.e. "dyn:getProp:color" would be the name used to describe a method that retrieves the property named "color" on the object it is invoked on.
        Returns:
        the number of tokens in the name of the method at the call site.

      • getNameToken

        String getNameToken(int i)
        Returns the ith token in the method name at the call site. Method names are tokenized with the colon ":" character.
        Parameters:
        i - the index of the token. Must be between 0 (inclusive) and getNameTokenCount() (exclusive)
        Returns:
        the ith token in the method name at the call site. The returned strings are interned.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the index is outside the allowed range.

      • getName

        String getName()
        Returns the name of the method at the call site. Note that the object internally only stores the tokenized name, and has to reconstruct the full name from tokens on each invocation.
        Returns:
        the name of the method at the call site.

      • getMethodType

        MethodType getMethodType()
        The type of the method at the call site.
        Returns:
        type of the method at the call site.

      • getLookup

        MethodHandles.Lookup getLookup()
        Returns the lookup passed to the bootstrap method.
        Returns:
        the lookup passed to the bootstrap method.

      • dropParameterTypes

        CallSiteDescriptor dropParameterTypes(int from,
                                    int to)
        Creates a new call site descriptor from this descriptor, which is identical to this, except it drops few of the parameters from the method type.
        Parameters:
        from - the index of the first parameter to drop
        to - the index of the first parameter after "from" not to drop
        Returns:
        a new call site descriptor with the parameter dropped.

      • changeParameterType

        CallSiteDescriptor changeParameterType(int num,
                                     Class<?> newType)
        Creates a new call site descriptor from this descriptor, which is identical to this, except it changes the type of one of the parameters in the method type.
        Parameters:
        num - the index of the parameter type to change
        newType - the new type for the parameter
        Returns:
        a new call site descriptor, with the type of the parameter in the method type changed.
